intro: Francoeuria rajputanae, commonly known as the Rajputana sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northwestern India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody, sprawling shrub form. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Francoeuria rajputanae is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Ayurvedic practices.
